user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of ws_receive_frame:
```c
static unsigned char *
ws_receive_frame (unsigned char *frame, ssize_t *length, int *type)
{
  unsigned char masks[4];
  unsigned char mask;
  unsigned char *msg;
  unsigned char flength;
  unsigned char idx_first_mask;
  unsigned char idx_first_data;
  size_t data_length;
  int i;
  int j;

  msg = NULL;
  if (frame[0] == (WS_FIN | WS_OPCODE_TEXT_FRAME))
  {
    *type = WS_OPCODE_TEXT_FRAME;
    idx_first_mask = 2;
    mask = frame[1];
    flength = mask & 0x7F;
    if (flength == 126)
    {
      idx_first_mask = 4;
    }
    else if (flength == 127)
    {
      idx_first_mask = 10;
    }
    idx_first_data = (unsigned char) (idx_first_mask + 4);
    data_length = (size_t) *length - idx_first_data;
    masks[0] = frame[idx_first_mask + 0];
    masks[1] = frame[idx_first_mask + 1];
    masks[2] = frame[idx_first_mask + 2];
    masks[3] = frame[idx_first_mask + 3];
    msg = malloc (data_length + 1);
    if (NULL != msg)
    {
      for (i = idx_first_data, j = 0; i < *length; i++, j++)
      {
        msg[j] = frame[i] ^ masks[j % 4];
      }
      *length = (ssize_t) data_length;
      msg[j] = '\0';
    }
  }
  else if (frame[0] == (WS_FIN | WS_OPCODE_CON_CLOSE_FRAME))
  {
    *type = WS_OPCODE_CON_CLOSE_FRAME;
  }
  else
  {
    *type = frame[0] & 0x0F;
  }
  return msg;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
else
  {
    *type = frame[0] & 0x0F;
  }
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation. The else branch is reachable whenever frame[0] does not equal (WS_FIN | WS_OPCODE_TEXT_FRAME) and does not equal (WS_FIN | WS_OPCODE_CON_CLOSE_FRAME). For example, if frame[0] == (WS_FIN | WS_OPCODE_PING_FRAME) or any other opcode value, the else branch executes and sets *type = frame[0] & 0x0F.
